title: Taraxacum officinale
summary: Taraxacum officinale, the dandelion or common dandelion,[5] is a flowering herbaceous perennial plant of the dandelion genus in the family Asteraceae (syn. Compositae). The common dandelion is well known for its yellow flower heads that turn into round balls of many silver-tufted fruits that disperse in the wind. These balls are usually called "clocks" in both British and American English.[6][7][8][9] The name "blowball" is also used.[10]
